intro: Cirsium cosmelii, commonly known as the Cosmelii thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, particularly in countries like Spain and Portugal. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
